H0.text: Patricia and her classmates will draw the rock shapes each time they visit a rocky area in the city to determine the types of rocks found there.

H1.text: Counting the rock numbers is what Patricia and her classmates will do each time they visit a rocky area in the city to determine what kinds of rocks can be found there, assuming the investigation is conducted correctly.

H2.text: Patricia and her classmates record the rock types and locations each time they visit a different rocky area in the city to determine the kinds of rocks present.

H3.text: Measure the rock masses and lengths is what Patricia and her classmates will do each time they visit an area when the investigation is done correctly, as they are visiting different rocky areas in the city to determine what kind of rocks can be found in each area.

A4.text: Rocks are classified according to characteristics such as mineral and chemical composition, permeability, texture of the constituent particles, and particle size.

A5.text: The proportion of silica in rocks and minerals is a major factor in determining their names and properties.
